flawed_nl_solution:
His smaller truck is 8000*0.3=<<8000*0.3=2400>>2400 gallons smaller
So it can transport 8000-2400=<<8000-2400=56000>>56000 gallons
There are 6-2-1=<<6-2-1=3>>3 of the very large trucks
Those trucks are each 8000*0.5=<<8000*0.5=4000>>4000 gallons larger
So they can transport 8000+4000=<<8000+4000=12000>>12000 gallons
So in total they transport 3*12000=<<3*12000=36000>>36000
The 8000-gallon trucks can transport 8000*2=<<8000*2=16000>>16000 gallons
So in total he can transport 56000+16000+36000=<<56000+16000+36000=108000>>108000 gallons
#### 108000

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 5600, not 56000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
